description: Windows Server 2012 R2 systems applying new Extended Security Update (ESU) licenses are failing to detect the latest security patches. Despite having the prerequisite ESU patch installed along with the servicing stack update from June 2023, the detection process is unsuccessful. This detection issue occurs for both internal Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) as well as direct patch detection from Microsoft's servers, causing systems to remain vulnerable to threats after the October 10, 2023 end-of-life date.
